name: 900.1 - Method Statement Development / Job Safety & Environmental Analysis

Detail of Activity - Prepare shared services trench construction methodology and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis suitable for site (eg access, working areas, proximity to slopes, traffic and other site hazards, construction stages proposed)
Acceptance Criteria - Method Statement and JSEA Completed and signed by relevant authority.
Comments - Method Statement and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis to be provided to Engineer for review prior to commencing excavation on site.
Detail of Activity - Check drawings are for construction and latest revision. Check Specification is for construction and latest revision
Acceptance Criteria - Drawings and Specification are the latest revision.
Record documents - IFC Drawings and Specification
Comments - Up to date drawings and specification to be reviewed before construction.
Detail of Activity - Ensure power supply is organised and is undertaken by an experience and competent contractor.
Acceptance Criteria - Unison to supply power to streetlight bases, subcontractor connecting streetlights to the network to be "approved" by the local electricity network company.
Detail of Activity - GPS Setout of the shared services trench location as per the construction drawings.
Minimum Test Frequency - All shared trenches.
Acceptance Criteria -  Streetlight set out locations do not clash with other features (i.e. existing/new services etc)
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Comments - Setout location prior to commencing works.
900.5 - Sediment Controls are in place for the particular section
Detail of Activity - Check ESCP and ensure any controls needed are in place before excavation.
Minimum Test Frequency - once per section
Acceptance Criteria - Erosion and Sediment controls are in place prior to starting works.
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation by contractor/installer of correct assembly per manufacturers instructions.

Acceptance Criteria - Installation to be 90 degrees to kerb and channel, pole tilt to be within 2o. Confirmation by contractor/installer of correct installation to manufacturers specification by contractor/installer.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure the correct pole type is installed per the latest IFC drawings.

Acceptance Criteria - Ensure poles are founded securely and have are adequatley backfilled to suit site conditions. Confirmation by contractor/installer of correct installation to manufacturers specification by contractor/installer.
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation by contractor/installer that all streetlights are earthed per installation requirements.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure the correct luminaire type is installed per the latest IFC drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure the correct luminaire tilt angle is installed per the latest IFC drawings. +/- 2O
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation by contractor/installer that streetlights and circuits have been satisfactorily tested in accordance with Electrical (Safety) Regulations 2010.
900.14 - Electrical certificate of compliance and electrical safety  certificate
Minimum Test Frequency - minimum once per Zone
Acceptance Criteria - All above documentation is shown as attached to this work pack.
Minimum Test Frequency - At completion of construction
Inspection / Test method - Asbuilts to be submitted at the completion of construction, information to be captured regularly.
Acceptance Criteria - Asbuilts reviewed and submitted (i.e. showing final location of all poles).
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with NZTA Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
